channel.title: A 'cure' for insomnia?
channel.description: I've had insomnia for a good while now, and I can't find a way to treat, or get rid of it. I've tried prescribed medicine, different types of sleep patterns, different ways to sleep (like falling asleep to music, etc), and sleeping in different positions (different ways on the bed, on the floor, on a couch, recliner, etc). My medicine used to work, but now it's come ineffective. I can't get more cause I'm no longer on insurance. Anyone got a good idea on something to try? (Aside from marijuana.)

item.title: A 'cure' for insomnia?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“Chrix, post:68, topic:479003”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=597220.msg4206919#msg4206919 date=1359064575]

My best cure is to get drunk and go to bed, I do it every night and insomnia is the reason.

There’s no way insomnia is the reason you get drunk every night. You’re an alcoholic.
[/quote]

Wrong I am a dedicated drunk, alcoholics go to meetings.[/quote]
Honey your words all you want, you’re an alcoholic

Read full topic

item.title: A 'cure' for insomnia?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Getting drunk is not necessary. One shot of 120 Proof Vodka is enough, for some who does not drink often, to become tired and sleep. This is assuming how your body reacts in a calming matter to small dosages.

  1. Get on a schedule
  2. No caffeine in the last 2 hours before bed
  3. When settling down and getting ready for the night, keep the lights dimmed
  4. Drink warm decaf tea (can be any tea pretty much I think)
  5. Right before bed take a shot of vodka and chase it down with water
  6. Go to the bathroom, do your business, then lay down. One SHOULD be able to sleep with a schedule like this.

Read full topic

But you could try praying and reading the bible before going to bed(beware of drooling! happens to me a lot).
Also i’ve seen that going to church and listening to the preacher sure does make kids and old ppl drowsy.[/quote]

Real as in? Like sleep walking, nightmares, or everything seems to be real?
[/quote]
You just have some pretty vivid dreams, like jme said[/quote]

Real as in? Like sleep walking, nightmares, or everything seems to be real?
[/quote]
I think he’s implying that you become high. But he’s lying, because melatonin is a completely natural substance that is released in order to make you feel tired each night.[/quote]
Your’re way off lol…

Real as in? Like sleep walking, nightmares, or everything seems to be real?

item.title: A 'cure' for insomnia?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

xxx123xxx:

Also, listen to that album by “the xx”, it’s called Coexist, very mellow songs and they knock me out

Music hasn’t proven to be efficient in helping me sleep.

[quote=“jme, post:49, topic:479003”]Something like it? Or did you actually try melatonin itself. Because it’s definitely worth looking into again. In terms of sleeping pills, it is by far the least harmful to your body. Give it a couple hours to kick in. I would be suprised if it didn’t help big time your first couple times using it. It’s normal for it to lose efficiency soon, however you can take virtually as much as you want without ODing. You can take breaks from it or combine it with your other sleeping methods.

And get some damn exercise, lol. If stairs are your only exercise, that could just be the problem in the first place. Don’t do it at night. Wear yourself out in the day.[/quote]
Yes like it, cause I couldn’t afford melotonin itself. Plus, you make it seem like I’m some fat ass. Last I was in the doctors (about 3 weeks ago) I weighed just under 120, and I’m 6 feet tall.

xxx123xxx:

Try to stay under 50 mg lol… near that and your dreams get a little real if you know what I mean lol

Real as in? Like sleep walking, nightmares, or everything seems to be real?

Read full topic

item.title: A 'cure' for insomnia?
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:49, topic:479003”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=597220.msg4205785#msg4205785 date=1358904189]

Try Melatonin(over the counter dietary supplement that promotes restful sleep)? That’s what I take when I can’t sleep. It’s pretty cheap if you just the get the generic pharmacy brand. I started with the 3 mg dosage, it’s like 6 or 7 dollars at rite-aid(if you’re from the states that is) for 60 pills.

I’ve taken something like it before. No good.
[/quote]

Something like it? Or did you actually try melatonin itself. Because it’s definitely worth looking into again. In terms of sleeping pills, it is by far the least harmful to your body. Give it a couple hours to kick in. I would be suprised if it didn’t help big time your first couple times using it. It’s normal for it to lose efficiency soon, however you can take virtually as much as you want without ODing. You can take breaks from it or combine it with your other sleeping methods.

And get some damn exercise, lol. If stairs are your only exercise, that could just be the problem in the first place. Don’t do it at night. Wear yourself out in the day.[/quote]

Try to stay under 50 mg lol… near that and your dreams get a little real if you know what I mean lol

Read full topic

Leave the window open slightly becauss that room is going to be filled up with carbon dioxide, drink a warm class of water, pee before you to to bed, turn tv off an hour before you go to sleep, and make you sure you don’t go to bed stressful. What types of music have you listened too trying to go to sleep?
[/quote]
yes make sure u get many classes of warm water b4 sleep

@Frell do u even lift[/quote]
why you gotta be a dick. I was trying to help.

item.title: A 'cure' for insomnia?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:479003”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=597220.msg4205353#msg4205353 date=1358866632]
Try Melatonin(over the counter dietary supplement that promotes restful sleep)? That’s what I take when I can’t sleep. It’s pretty cheap if you just the get the generic pharmacy brand. I started with the 3 mg dosage, it’s like 6 or 7 dollars at rite-aid(if you’re from the states that is) for 60 pills.
[/quote]
I’ve taken something like it before. No good.[/quote]

Something like it? Or did you actually try melatonin itself. Because it’s definitely worth looking into again. In terms of sleeping pills, it is by far the least harmful to your body. Give it a couple hours to kick in. I would be suprised if it didn’t help big time your first couple times using it. It’s normal for it to lose efficiency soon, however you can take virtually as much as you want without ODing. You can take breaks from it or combine it with your other sleeping methods.

And get some damn exercise, lol. If stairs are your only exercise, that could just be the problem in the first place. Don’t do it at night. Wear yourself out in the day.

Read full topic
